intro: Psychotria pachecoana, commonly known as the Pacheco's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the humid lowland forests of Ecuador, specifically in the Andean region. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which are often clustered in inflorescences. It grows as an evergreen shrub, typically reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
